comments:
Build ID: 3.2.1

Steps To Reproduce:
1. prepare two simple java classes:


public class service1 {
	
	public data1 op(data1 in) {
		return null;
	}
}

public class data1 {

	int a;
	int b;
	public int getA() {
		return a;
	}
	public void setA(int a) {
		this.a = a;
	}
	public int getB() {
		return b;
	}
	public void setB(int b) {
		this.b = b;
	}
}

2. try to create a new web service
3. the following exception is the result

"data1" has already a Getter/Setter Java operations ... 
So I am not sure if this is a bug. It is repeatable.

More information:

A couple questions for you:
1. Are you running WTP 1.5.2 on Eclipse 3.2.1?
2. Did you create your Java classes in a Java project or in a Web project? If the former, you need to also create the Web project in which the wizard will deploy the Axis servlet, and add your Java project as a J2EE dependency to the Web project before running the wizard.

Thanks - CB.

(In reply to comment #1)
